name: Mir Sazzat Hossain
description:
I am a recent college graduate with a strong foundation in computer science and a range of skills including data analysis, machine learning, and computer vision. Currently, I work as a Research Assistant at the Center for Computational and Data Sciences (CCDS) at Independent University, Bangladesh (IUB), where I focus on research projects related to computer vision, group theory, manifold learning, and geometric machine learning. 
In addition to my research responsibilities, I also teach undergraduate students, mentor students, and instruct the numerical method lab course at IUB. My passion for learning new data science topics and conducting research drives me to make significant contributions and have a positive impact on others' learning. I am constantly striving to expand my knowledge and expertise in the field and make a meaningful impact through my work.
